Description: Made by the estate that put this celebrated cru on the map, and showing an enviable combination of elegance and power, this stunning wine opens with aromas of wild berries, underbrush, dark spice and balsamic notes of cedar and new leather. The tense, savory palate is loaded with youthful energy, showing succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry, cinnamon and star anise framed in tightly knit, refined tannins and surprisingly bright acidity for the vintage. A mineral note suggesting iron adds depth to the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elvio Cogno 2017 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Perfumed berry, truffle, violet and balsamic aromas of camphor are just some of the aromas you'll find on this gorgeous wine. Full-bodied, it's loaded with flavor and finesse, doling out juicy raspberry, ripe Morello cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside tightly knit, refined tannins. It's absolutely delicious and will continue to develop beautifully over the next decade. Best 2023–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2017 Acclivi  (Barolo)

Description: From the township of Novello and from what is now widely recognized as one of the denomination's top vineyard sites, this is just stunning, offering intense aromas of wild berries, new leather, floral notes, camphor and grilled herb. The delicious, structured palate shows finesse and power, featuring ripe red cherry, blood orange, cedar, licorice and mineral notes suggesting tangy iron. Noble tannins provide support. Reflecting the vintage, this won't need years to come around but will also age well for at least another decade. Drink 2022–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2017 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Elegantly structured and delicious, this fragrant red has enticing scents of ripe forest berries, iris, truffle and balsamic whiffs of camphor. Combining body and finesse, the savory, focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice before an almost salty finish. Tightly knit, fine-grained tannins provide support while fresh acidity keeps it well-balanced. Drink 2024–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brovia 2017 Villero  (Barolo)

Description: Loaded with finesse, this wine has enticing aromas of rose, woodland berry, pine forest and herbs. Elegantly structured, the delicious palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and wild mint framed in tightly knit, polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it well-balanced. Drink 2022–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgogno 2016 Liste  (Barolo)

Description: Wild berry, menthol and tilled earth aromas mingle with whiffs of dark spice. Linear and savory, the lithe palate is already immediate, featuring juicy raspberry, red cherry, crushed mint and star anise accompanied by taut, polished tannins. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh and bright.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2017 Coste di Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, pine forest, woodland berries and cedar form the enticing nose. Full-bodied and savory, the structured palate delivers ripe Morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and cinnamon before closing on pipe tobacco notes. Tightly knit but refined tannins provide the backbone, while surprisingly fresh acidity for the hot vintage keeps it balanced. Drink 2024–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2017 Bricco delle Viole  (Barolo)

Description: Full-bodied and delicious, this opens with aromas of menthol, ripe wild berries, new leather and blue flowers. Reflecting the nose, the ripe, generous palate features cherry marinated in spirits, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco framed in tightly knit, noble tannins. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poderi Colla 2017 Bussia Dardi Le Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing aromas suggesting new leather, violet, raspberry tart and forest floor are front and center. It's young and primary but also full-bodied and delicious, featuring ripe Marasca cherry, licorice, truffle and the barest hint of game before finishing on a hint of graphite. Assertive, fine-grained tannins provide support and need a few more years to integrate. This shows real aging potential, especially for the hot vintage. Drink 2025–2037.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiavenza 2017 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor, purple flower and forest berry slowly take shape in this classy, full-bodied red. It combines structure and finesse, featuring crushed raspberry, juicy Marasca cherry, tobacco and baking spice framed in taut, elegant tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it nicely balanced. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pio Cesare 2017 Mosconi  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, forest berry, botanical herb, menthol and truffle aromas are front and center on this gorgeous, sublimely scented Nebbiolo. Made by one of the denomination's rising stars, it's all about elegance, precision and energy, delivering juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and crushed mint flavors alongside taut, refined tannins. Bright acidity keeps it radiant, and a savory, saline mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink 2023–2038.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Guelpa 2018  Lessona

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor and cedar mingle with rose and leather on this full-boded, savory red. Structured and delicious, the juicy palate is still youthfully austere, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, baking spice and licorice framed in noble tannins before a black tea finish. Drink 2025–2037.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Luigi Baudana 2017 Baudana  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, forest berry, dark spice and crushed mint aromas shape the nose on this fragrant red. The full-bodied, delicious palate features juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote and star anise alongside youthfully tight, fine-grained tannins. It closes on a white pepper note. It's elegant but still young, so give it a few more years to fully integrate and develop. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2017 Vigna La Rosa  (Barolo)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with leather, violet, tilled earth and fruitcake. Reflecting the nose, the enveloping, concentrated palate combines power and elegance, doling out ripe black-skinned berries, baking spice and crushed mint alongside tightly knit, velvety tannins. Drink 2024–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2017 Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Absolutely delicious, this opens with heady aromas of rose, cedar, leather and camphor. It's elegant and structured, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and saline notes alongside polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mirafiore 2015 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with energy and finesse, this has enticing scents of perfumed berries, star anise, wild herbs and violet. The linear, structured palate is focused and intense, delivering succulent red cherry, orange zest, crushed mint and licorice before a saline mineral close. A backbone of firm, refined tannins and tangy acidity provide support. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brezza 2017 Castellero  (Barolo)

Description: Camphor, wild berry, new leather and blue flower aromas emerge on the nose of this savory wine. Full-bodied and delicious, the structured palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, baking spice and a hint of menthol alongside firm, refined tannins. This is an incredible performance for what is the firm's entry-level Barolo. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Massolino 2017  Barolo

Description: Pressed rose, grilled porcini mushroom, ripe berry and camphor aromas lift out of the glass on this fragrant red. The full-bodied, savory palate is concentrated but also boasts finesse, featuring fleshy raspberry, dried cherry, licorice and tobacco set against a backbone of noble tannins. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2017 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, rose, new leather and a whiff of forest floor shape the nose. It's full-bodied and still youthfully austere, offering sour cherry, pomegranate and star anise framed in tightly knit, fine-grained tannins that need a few more years to unwind. Drink 2024–2929.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brezza 2017 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with ripe berries, leather and a whiff of hazelnut. On the full-bodied, concentrated palate, velvety tannins envelope dried cherry, licorice, coffee bean and the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink 2024–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruna Grimaldi 2017 Badarina  (Barolo)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this opens with aromas ripe berries, truffle and rose. Polished and savory, the palate offers raspberry, crushed strawberry and star anise set against lithe tannins. This is already enjoyable but will also offer great midterm aging potential. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brezza 2017  Barolo

Description: Wild red berry, camphor, truffle and dark spice aromas form the inviting nose. Elegantly structured, the savory palate also has youthful tension, delivering ripe Morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and tobacco blend set against taut, fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2024–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Alessandria 2017 del Comune di Verduno  (Barolo)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this mountaintop Nebbiolo is a revelation, offering delicate strawberry, hibiscus, tea and sandalwood aromas on the nose. There's a firm but pleasantly relenting grip to the tannins, allowing strawberry, potpourri and vanilla flavors to emerge elegantly, carrying into a long, graham cracker-sprinkled finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Lago Lomita Vineyard Partners' Reserve Nebbiolo (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Rose, crushed mint, camphor and new leather aromas mingle with ripe dark-skinned fruit. Full-bodied and enveloping, the concentrated palate offers fleshy black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside the warmth of alcohol. Velvety tannins envelope the rich flavors. It finishes on a salty note. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruna Grimaldi 2017 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: Ripe berry, baking spice, menthol and blue flower aromas shape the lovely nose. Juicy and elegantly structured, the savory palate doles out raspberry compote, mature Marasca cherry, star anise and cinnamon before closing on a hint of hazelnut. Taut, refined tannins provide lithe support. It's already delicious and accessible but will also provide several years or more of pleasure. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2017 della Tradizione  (Barolo)

Description: Ripe plum, blue flower, cedar and sunbaked earth aromas lead the way. On the full-bodied, savory palate, tightly knit, refined tannins envelope raspberry jam, fleshy black cherry and baking spice. Best 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pio Cesare 2017 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, prune, leather and pipe tobacco aromas make their way to the forefront. Showing the heat of the vintage, it's full-bodied and concentrated, offering cherry marinated in spirits, licorice and the warmth of evident alcohol. Tightly knit, enveloping tannins provide firm, velvety support. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Luigi Baudana 2017 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Enveloping and delicious, this has aromas evoking cedar, camphor, pipe tobacco and forest floor. Full-bodied and savory, the palate offers mature Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of toasted hazelnut alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2025–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Alessandria 2017 San Lorenzo di Verduno  (Barolo)

Description: Grilled herb, underbrush and camphor aromas escape the glass along with whiffs of game and violet. On the full-bodied, savory palate, compact, close-grained tannins envelope ripe black cherry, baking spice and truffle before a mocha finish. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Ballarin 2017 Tre Ciabot  (Barolo)

Description: Silky and smooth, this poised red opens with aromas of woodland berry, forest floor and camphor. It's savory and polished, offering flavors of juicy black cherry and licorice with a hint of hazelnut before finishing on a note of blood orange. Lithe tannins and fresh acidity keep it balanced. It's already accessible, but will also age well for several years. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgogno 2016  Barolo

Description: Lovely aromas of perfumed berries, rose and forest floor lift out of the glass. On the elegant, linear palate, polished tannins accompany sour cherry, orange zest and star anise, while tangy acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marcarini 2017 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: New leather, truffle and camphor aromas mingle with a whiff of wild berries on this earthy red. The ripe, accessible palate doles out fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry, culinary spice and game alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2017 Tortoniano  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, menthol, new leather and pipe tobacco aromas slowly form on this inviting red. Generous and full-bodied, the savory, concentrated palate doles out ripe black cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and baking spice accompanied by fine-grained velvety tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2024–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2017 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Delicately scented, this medium-bodied wine has aromas of red berries, grilled herbs, sunbaked earth and truffle. Savory and linear, the palate offers juicy Morello cherry, blood orange and star anise alongside taut, fine-grained tannins before closing on a saline note. While you won't need years before you can enjoy this, it also promises good midterm aging potential. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barale Fratelli 2017 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, rose and camphor aromas waft out of the glass. Tangy and delicious, the smooth, full-bodied palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, fleshy raspberry and hints of ground baking spice framed in taut, polished tannins. It's already accessible but also has good midterm aging potential. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2017 Albe  (Barolo)

Description: Tobacco, blue flower, sunbaked earth and leather aromas form the nose along with a whiff of dried mint. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate is already rather evolved, offering dried cherry, grilled porcini mushroom and licorice alongside taut, close-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close. Despite the firm tannins, drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiavenza 2017 Broglio  (Barolo)

Description: This opulent red has aromas of baked plum, toasted hazelnut, menthol and dark spice. The aromas carry on to the bold, concentrated palate along with licorice, the warmth of evident alcohol and a saline note. Showing the heat of the vintage, it's brawny and already accessible. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruna Grimaldi 2017 Camilla  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of French oak, ripe dark-skinned fruit and cedar form the nose. Linear and firmly structured, the palate offers dried cherry, tangy orange zest and ground clove alongside close-grained, mouth-drying tannins that grip the close. Give the tannins a couple of years to unwind, then drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the fruit richness. Drink 2023–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mauro Veglio 2017 2017  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas recalling violet, underbrush and wild berries shape the nose on this lithe, focused red. Linear and ethereal, the vibrant palate offers red cherry, black tea, strawberry and a tangy mineral note suggesting rusty nail. Taut, refined tannins provide support. Drink 2024–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marcarini 2017 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of grilled porcini mushroom, botanical herbs, new leather and baked plum shape the nose. Brawny and bold, the forward, concentrated palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and a hint of coffee bean alongside enveloping, close-grained tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining energy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2017 R56  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, grilled porcini mushroom, eucalyptus and ripe berry aromas waft out of the glass. On the full-bodied, concentrated palate, assertive, close-grained tannins accompany dried cherry, kirsch, tobacco leaf and the heat of evident alcohol. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind, then drink sooner rather than later to capture the fruit and freshness. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2017 Meriame  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, menthol, dark spice and ripe black-skinned fruit aromas mingle together in the glass. Savory and full-bodied, the palate opens with fleshy Morello cherry, French oak, roasted coffee bean and saline notes before tight, close-grained tannins leave a firm, grippy close. Drink 2024–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2017 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, blue flowers, leather and baked plum slowly make their way to the forefront along with a whiff of grilled herbs. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate offers dried cherry and licorice alongside firm, close-grained tannins that leave an assertive finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind, then drink sooner rather than later to capture the fruit and freshness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiavenza 2017 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of forest floor, camphor, violet and stewed prune slowly appear in the glass along with spicy notes. Full-bodied and enveloping, the forward, accessible palate reflects the heat of the vintage, featuring the same prune note as the nose, as well as dried cherry and licorice framed in velvety, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barale Fratelli 2015 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, leather, truffle and a floral note of iris. The palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering dried cherry, ground clove and a hint of game alongside taut tannins. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2017  Barolo

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling begins with snappy aromas of red currants, sage and dried strawberry on the nose. It's tense and grippy on the palate, where the firm tannins deliver intensely spicy notes atop the strawberry core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Nebbiolo (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very tart and tangy aromas of strawberry balsamic meet with an array of herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also tart, though that element dissipates with patience to reveal richer red-fruit and dusty herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cavaletti 2018 Nebbiolo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This rather rigid wine shows earthy, Sherry-like, leathery scents, a lean, grippy mouthfeel and cranberry and black-tea flavors on firm tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathew Gibson 2016 Estate Nebbiolo (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Delicate aromas of forest berry, new leather, violet and camphor waft out of the glass. Elegantly structured, the savory palate doles out strawberry compote, crushed raspberry and star anise alongside bright acidity. It's full bodied but the lithe tannins and the freshness give it an almost weightless feel. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mirafiore 2016  Barolo

Description: Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this vibrant sparkler offers inviting aromas of white stone fruit, chamomile and bread crust. On the bone-dry, savory palate, an elegant perlage accompanies pomegranate, Empire apple and baking-spice notes lifted by crisp acidity. A fennel note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2015 Metodo Classico Nebolè Dosaggio Zero Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: All about fragrance and finesse, this radiant red opens with enticing scents of perfumed berry, menthol, rose petal and a hint of dried aromatic herb. Vinified only in steel, it's precise, pristine and delicious, delivering strawberry compote, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and focused.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2019 Nebbiolo (Langhe)

Description: This delicately hued salmon-colored sparkler offers enticing aromas of red berry, vanilla and Gala apple. Reflecting the nose, the savory, creamy palate offers brioche, red cherry and pastry cream alongside a lively perlage and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cuvage 2016 Rosé Brut Metodo Classico  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of red woodland berry, menthol, rose and an earthy whiff of tilled soil are front and center on this lovely red. The vibrant, elegant palate doles out strawberry compote, star anise and baking spice, alongside taut, polished tannins. It's already going down easily but will offer several years or more of sheer drinking pleasure. Enjoy through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2016  Barolo

Description: Bright and savory, this shows Nebbiolo's playful side, offering aromas and flavors of juicy red cherry, botanical herb, menthol and star anise. Bright acidity and lithe tannins keep it fresh and easygoing. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ettore Germano 2019 Nebbiolo (Langhe)

Description: Tannic and smoky, with meaty midpalate, this is a robust, rustic and dusty wine, chewy in raisiny tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2017 Camporelli Vineyard Reserve Nebbiolo (Sonoma Valley)

Description: A dazzling showing that combines Old School structure with finesse, this stunning red offers sublime aromas of rose, camphor, dark-skinned berry and new leather. Full bodied and delicious, the compelling palate delivers fruit purity and complexity, featuring ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and tobacco. A backbone of noble tannins and vibrant acidity keeps it impeccably balanced. 2025–2053.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva
Name: Cavallotto 2013 Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, new leather, sunbaked soil and a whiff of violet shape the nose on this enthralling wine. Full bodied and boasting a concentrated depth of delicious flavors, the structured linear palate delivers mature Morello cherry, blood orange, star anise and tobacco set against a backbone of firm but refined tannins. Fresh acidity provides balance. Drink 2027–2040.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Pajè Vecchie Viti  (Barbaresco)

Description: You can lose yourself just in the aromas of this drop-dead gorgeous wine, thanks to a lovely bouquet that recalls rose, violet, vineyard dust, licorice and menthol. Boasting a winning combination of structure and finesse, the precise, full-bodied palate features juicy red cherry, raspberry, tobacco and white pepper alongside noble, enveloping tannins. It's impeccably balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2025–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2015 Monprivato  (Barolo)

Description: Showing more strength and intensity than you normally find in Barbaresco, this stunning red opens with heady scents of wild berry, new leather, underbrush and menthol. The compelling palate features mature black raspberry, juicy cherry and licorice before finishing on a note of tobacco. It's still youthfully nervous and austere so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2027–2040.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Montefico Vecchie Viti  (Barbaresco)

Description: Focused and fragrant, this striking red offers enticing perfumes recalling violet, rose, red berry and menthol. Showing extreme elegance, energy and precision, the palate doles out succulent cherry, raspberry, orange zest and star anise while a sprinkling of white pepper graces the lingering finish. Taut, refined tannins and bright acidity provide wonderful balance. Drink 2026–2046.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2016  Barolo

Description: Focused and fragrant, this striking red offers enticing perfumes recalling violet, rose, red berry and menthol. Showing extreme elegance, energy and precision, the palate doles out succulent cherry, raspberry, orange zest and star anise while a sprinkling of white pepper graces the lingering finish. Taut, refined tannins and bright acidity provide wonderful balance. Drink 2026–2046.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2016  Barolo

Description: Another drop-dead gorgeous wine from this dynamic estate, this elegantly structured wine opens with tantalizing aromas of camphor, fragrant purple flower, ripe berry, sunbaked earth and tobacco. Made with fruit from old vines, the youngest dating back to 1937, the compelling palate combines structure and grace, delivering pristine fruit sensations of strawberry compote and red cherry while licorice, baking spice and truffle add depth. Refined tannins and fresh acidity keep it balanced and vibrant. Drink 2023–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Pira Vechie Viti  (Barolo)

Description: From one of the greatest vineyard sites in Barbaresco, this captivating wine boasts enticing perfumes of fragrant purple flower, pressed rose, new leather, forest floor and dark spice. The palate is both elegant and earthy, doling out juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, truffle and star anise before finishing on the barest hint of game. Taut, refined tannins and bright acidity keep it focused and balanced. Drink 2025–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Asili Vecchie Viti  (Barbaresco)

Description: Gorgeous, fragrant and structured, this has enticing scents of violet, camphor, orange zest and red berry. The focused palate boasts great energy, doling out strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside taut, elegant tannins and vibrant acidity. Just fantastic. Drink 2024–2041.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giuseppe Rinaldi 2016 Tre Tine  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, rose and star anise mingle with scents of pine forest on this compelling, full-bodied red. Hailing from one of Barolo's most illustrious crus, it's is a classic in the making, delivering juicy red cherry, baking spice and menthol alongside noble tannins. It's precise, structured and elegant, with a savory, lingering finish. Drink 2023–2043.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oddero 2013 Vignarionda  (Barolo)

Description: Camphor, truffle, wild berry and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll encounter on this riveting red. The enveloping, delicious palate shows both power and finesse, featuring dried cherry, pomegranate, star anise and tobacco framed in noble tannins. Surprisingly bright acidity for the warm vintage lends balance and even more intensity. Drink 2022–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2012 Crichet Pajè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Leather, forest floor, rose and camphor aromas take shape on this fragrant red along with a whisper of tobacco. Polished, linear and savory, the elegantly structured palate features juicy cranberry, orange zest, licorice and a hint of baking spice. Taut, refined tannins provide support while fresh acidity keeps it nicely balanced. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Pira  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing aromas of red berry, baking spice, crushed rose and chopped mint waft out of the glass. It's all about intensity, complexity and elegance, delivering mature Marasca cherry, orange zest, licorice and tobacco before closing on a note of smoky flint. Taut but refined tannins provide support while fresh acidity lends perfect balance. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2015 Perno Vigna Santo Stefano  (Barolo)

Description: Balsamic notes of camphor meld with ripe dark-skinned cherry, leather and dark spice. Delicious and loaded with personality, the enveloping palate doles out juicy black cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside earthy hints of truffle and game. Tightly knit, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink after 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 Pajè  (Barbaresco)

Description: From one of the most legendary vineyard sites in all of Barolo, this soulful, full-bodied red opens with aromas of leather, truffle, tobacco, baked plum and a hint of game. Compelling, velvety and delicious, the palate features fleshy Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and baking spice accompanied by firm, polished tannins that lend finesse. It's already showing beautifully but will age wonderfully for years to come. Drink through 2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Anselma Giacomo 2012 Vignarionda Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and showing great class and pedigree, this opens with alluring aromas of wild berry, forest floor, new leather and dark spice. On the smooth, delicious palate, taut fine-grained tannins seamlessly support ripe Morello cherry, raspberry, licorice and tobacco before a flinty finish. Drink 2022–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2015 Tre Vigne  (Gattinara)

Description: This compelling wine opens with enticing aromas of camphor, toasted hazelnut, white pepper and pipe tobacco. Demonstrating the firm's hallmark of power and finesse, the structured, focused palate shows Morello cherry, orange slice and licorice framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. It's well balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2025–2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2015 Villero  (Barolo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nebbiolo lovers should lament that Bryan Harrington is retiring his brand, as he mastered the grape like few others in California. This bottling is full of spicy plum, raspberry, pepper, rose and earthy soils on the nose. The palate combines those rocky flavors and structure with rosewater, light strawberry, tar and nutmeg, elements that will only focus with time. Drink 2023–2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Harrington 2016 Luna Matta Vineyard Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, leather, camphor and sunbaked soil form the nose. Structured and enveloping, the full-bodied palate presents dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and tobacco. It's concentrated with a velvety texture, thanks to firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2024–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Anselma Giacomo 2012 Felice Anselma 100 Anni Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush and leather align with dark spice and blue flower on this full-bodied red. Velvety and savory, the enveloping palate is loaded with personality, delivering ripe black cherry, licorice, tobacco and game alongside a backbone of noble tannins. It's a quintessential, old school Barolo and that's a good thing. Drink through 2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Anselma Giacomo 2013 Collaretto Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, menthol, new leather and wild berry aromas waft out of the glass. The elegant palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, baking spice and a hint of rusty nail alongside taut, polished tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2015 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, camphor, pipe tobacco, leather and tilled earth are just some of the aromas that appear in this full-bodied, fragrant red. Elegantly structured, the focused palate features ripe black cherry, licorice and clove framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it vibrant. Drink 2026–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2016 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, tilled earth, blue flower and wild herb aromas meld together on this racy red. The savory, medium-bodied palate features juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and flinty mineral set against a backbone of firm acidity and taut, refined tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2014 Tre Vigne  (Gattinara)

Description: Made with dried Nebbiolo grapes, this has aromas recalling mature dark-skinned fruit, baking spice, flint and menthol. The bold, velvety palate doles out baked plum, raspberry jam, vanilla and nutmeg framed in densely woven, fine-grained tannins before closing on an almost tangy mineral note. Drink through 2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2015 Il Sogno  (Gattinara)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor and dark spice shape the nose along with a whiff of blue flower. The firmly structured, medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, star anise, clove and tobacco framed in tight, close-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2015 Riserva  (Gattinara)

Appellation: Vino Rosso d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Rose, violet and red-berry aromas mingle with a whiff of alpine herb. Juicy and delicious, the smooth, graceful palate features Marasca cherry, blood orange and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Guelpa 2018 Longitudine 8.26 Nebbiolo (Vino Rosso d'Italia)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of dark-skinned berry, new leather, underbrush, violet and camphor mingle together in the glass. The full-bodied, chewy palate doles out ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, baking spice and tobacco framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. It closes on an almond note. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Anselma Giacomo 2015  Barolo

Description: Earthy and downright delicious, this has aromas of forest floor, violet, new leather, game and tobacco. The full-bodied, enveloping palate doles out fleshy black cherry, mature plum, licorice and cinnamon alongside fine-grained, velvety tannins. Give it time to fully unwind and develop. Drink 2024–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Varej 2016  Barolo

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry and baking spice follow through to the focused, savory palate along with licorice and orange zest. It's linear and structured, with taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2024–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2016 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of rose, blue flower and perfumed berry mingle with whiffs of alpine herb and camphor on this fragrant red. Medium bodied and loaded with finesse and energy, the elegant palate doles out ripe black cherry, licorice and tobacco before closing a mineral note suggesting iron. Polished tannins and bright acidity provide lithe support. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2016  Gattinara

Description: Aromas of tar, smoke, pressed rose, leather and prune slowly take shape in the glass. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with dried cherry and tobacco while fine-grained, drying tannins provide support. It's still holding up, but enjoy it sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit and freshness. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2009 10 Anni Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of ripe berry, pipe tobacco and new leather form the nose. Firmly structured, the palate offers juicy black cherry, baked plum and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2026–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2016 Simposio  (Barolo)

Description: Forest-floor and wild-berry aromas mingle with whiffs of rose and menthol. Smooth and concentrated, the medium-bodied palate offers fleshy Marasca cherry, raspberry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Preziosa 2016 Castleng Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Red-berry, rose, tobacco and tilled soil aromas rise out of the glass on this 100% Nebbiolo from Alto Piemonte. It's still youthfully austere, offering dried Marasca cherry, orange zest and licorice alongside a backbone of assertive, fine-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to unclench then drink to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Nova 2011  Ghemme

Description: Aromas of blue flowers, baking spices and leather lead the way in this firm red. The taut, linear palate offers ripe black cherry, orange zest and star anise alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the close. Drink after 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Luca Bosio 2016  Barolo

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, violet and dark spice mingle with balsamic notes of camphor. Elegantly structured, the linear palate reveals mature Morello cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully unwind. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2017  Gattinara

Description: Violet, red-berry and dark-spice aromas shape the nose on this young, vibrant red. The savory, easy-drinking palate offers juicy Morello cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside bright acidity and smooth, supple tannins. It shows the lighter side of Nebbiolo and is ready to enjoy now. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglini 2019 Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Made entirely with 100% Nebbiolo, this pretty sparkler has aromas of violet, red berry and just a hint of bread dough. On the lively palate, bright acidity accompanies pomegranate, strawberry and a hint of baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gabriele Scaglione NV Metodo Classico Rosé Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and orange rind follow over to the palate along with sour cherry, camphor and a hint of aniseed. It closes on an espresso note while grainy tannins clench the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roccheviberti 2016 Bricco Boschis  (Barolo)

Description: Violet and red-berry aromas mingle with dark spice on this bright, youthful red. Linear and racy, the palate shows black cherry, orange zest and ground brown pepper alongside zesty acidity and taut tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ioppa 2019 Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Aromas of damp underbrush, oak, menthol and a whiff of incense form the subtle nose. The lean palate shows oak-driven sensations of coconut, exotic spice and toasted nut alongside a note of powdered sage but it lacks fruit richness. Astringent tannins leave a bracing, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of forest floor, coconut and a whiff of eucalyptus. Mirroring the nose, the palate suggests French oak, espresso and butterscotch alongside the barest hint of orange rind. Assertive, grainy tannins leave a clenching, abrupt finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2014 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This ten-year-old wine has aromas recalling underbrush, carob, flint, prune and sunbaked soil. The aromas carry over to the rather lean palate alongside firm, drying tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish. It still has firm acidity but the fruit has largely vanished so drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Nova 2010 San Quirico Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Aromas of adhesive bandage, walnut and bread crust lead the nose along with orange zest. The aromas carry over to the brisk palate, along with honey and bitter-almond set against steely bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2016 Metodo Classico Rosé Neboise  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: This varietal Nebbiolo offers up a blender's worth of funk on the nose: compost, onion, wet wool and stewed fruit. A tannic palate feels raw, while flavors of scallion, fennel and berry fruits finish dry and tannic.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cerro Chapeu 2018 Reserva Limited Edition Estate Selection Nebbiolo (Uruguay)

Description: By Italian standards, this Nebbiolo is a fruit bomb. But this isn't Italy and this wine isn't pretending it is. It both smells and looks like freshly squeezed strawberry juice, with delicate aromas of rose petal and spice just beneath the surface. There's a gorgeous purity of fruit, which is, frankly shocking, considered it was fermented 100% whole bunch. The paradoxes continue on the palate, where Nebbiolo's characteristic delicacy and power shine. The shimmering fruit is tightly laced by tannins and buoyed by pristine natural acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Mayer 2018 Nebbiolo (Yarra Valley)

Description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, iris and a whiff of eucalyptus emerge from the glass. Elegantly structured and delicious, the full-bodied palate doles out mature morello cherry, raspberry, white pepper and star anise while polished tannins lend finesse. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Rocca 2017 Ovello Vigna Loreto  (Barbaresco)

Description: Rose, iris, menthol and mature berry are just some of the aromas you'll find on this stunning, full-bodied wine. On the polished, savory palate, notes of star anise and tobacco accent a core of ripe Marasca cherry while fine-grained tannins offer structure and elegance. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Rocca 2017 Ronchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant and focused, this smooth elegant red offers enticing aromas of pressed rose, botanical herb, forest berry and culinary spice. On the delicious palate, taut polished tannins accompany succulent morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and chopped mint. Fresh acidity keeps it well balanced. It's already drinking beautifully but will offer several years or more of pleasure. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Guelpa 2017 Nebbiolo (Sizzano)

Description: Fragrant aromas of purple flower, herbs and new leather come to the forefront alongside a whiff of tilled earth. Taut and loaded with youthful tension, the delicious, focused palate features juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and baking spice. Fine-grained tannins lend finesse while bright acidity keeps it balanced and vibrant. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Spinona 2016 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, fragrant blue flower and new leather waft form the enticing nose. Boasting structure and finesse, the full-bodied, enveloping palate features juicy morello cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice framed in taut velvety tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ugo Lequio 2017 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Perfumed and loaded with finesse, this opens with enticing scents of baked plum, fragrant blue flower, aromatic herb and pipe tobacco. The smooth, full-bodied palate doles out juicy plum, ripe morello cherry and baking spice framed in taut, refined tannins. It closes on a mocha note. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Rocca 2017 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of camphor, forest berry and oak-driven spice slowly take shape in the glass along with whiffs of pressed rose and botanical herb. Youthfully austere, the tense linear palate offers red cherry, cranberry, star anise and crushed mint before an almost salty mineral close. Taut fine-grained tannins provide seamless support. Drink 2024–2037.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Guelpa 2017  Lessona

Description: Camphor, violet and ripe forest-berry aromas come to the forefront. It's enveloping and elegantly structured, doling out juicy black cherry, crushed cranberry and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Rocca 2017 Cottà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant purple flower, tilled soil, wild berry and an espresso note shape the enticing nose. Elegantly structured, the focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, strawberry compote and licorice while taut fine-grained tannins provide seamless support. It's nicely balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2022–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruno Rocca 2016 Currà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Camphor, forest berry, rose and exotic spice form the inviting nose Full-bodied and enveloping, the palate features dried cherry, tobacco and mocha before close-grained tannins grip the assertive close. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy 2017 Martinenga  (Barbaresco)
Winery: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy

Description: Intense floral aromas of rose and iris mingle with forest berry, dried mint and underbrush on this chiseled Nebbiolo. Racy and elegant, the radiant palate offers spiced cranberry, blood orange, star anise and botanical herb before closing on salty mineral note evoking rusty iron. Vibrant acidity and taut fine-grained tannins provide age-worthy support. Drink 2023–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torraccia del Piantavigna 2016  Gattinara

Description: Enticing scents of rose, blue flower, tilled earth and sandalwood waft out of the glass on this fragrant red. Savory and structured, the taut, elegant palate features juicy Marasca cherry, spiced cranberry and star anise framed in tightly knit fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully unwind. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2017  Barbaresco

Description: This full-boded red offers aromas evoking blue flower, baked plum and pipe tobacco. The firm but polished palate shows concentration and structure, featuring dried cherry, steeped prune and licorice set against fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Musso 2017 Pora  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing scents of rose, blue flower, tilled earth and sandalwood waft out of the glass on this fragrant red. Savory and structured, the taut, elegant palate features juicy Marasca cherry, spiced cranberry and star anise framed in tightly knit fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully unwind. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of fragrant purple flower, spiced plum, new leather and a whiff of menthol shape the nose. Full bodied and enveloping, the smooth, accessible palate doles out succulent black cherry, raspberry compote and star anise framed in polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2017 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing aromas of violet, ripe berry, new leather and camphor lift out of the glass along with a whiff of smoke. On the elegant, polished palate, taut, refined tannins accompany dried cherry, tobacco and star anise. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Vano 2017 Canova  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of ripe wild berry, violet, truffle and baking spice fill the glass. Concentrated but showing a polished elegance, the full-bodied palate delivers mature morello cherry, raspberry compote, tobacco and cinnamon. Fine-grained tannins provide a taut framework. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pertinace 2017 Marcarini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers cranberry, black cherry, tobacco and a hint of clove alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2032.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ressia 2015 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, blue flower, leather and dark-spice aromas are front and center on this fragrant red. Elegant and focused, the savory, chiseled palate features juicy red cherry, spiced cranberry and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandrone 2018 Valmaggiore  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Underbrush, blue flower, leather and dark-spice aromas are front and center on this fragrant red. Elegant and focused, the savory, chiseled palate features juicy red cherry, spiced cranberry and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandrone 2018 Valmaggiore  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Enticing scents recalling iris, berry, menthol and baking spice shape the nose on this fragrant red. Polished and savory, the elegant palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and a dollop of vanilla while taut, refined tannins provide lithe support. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Col dei Venti 2017 Tufoblu  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue-flower, smoky graphite and spiced plum aromas lead the way. On the smooth full-bodied palate, polished tannins elegantly support dried black cherry, baking spice and tobacco. It's already accessible but will also offer several more years of drinking pleasure. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bera 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of rose, violet and wild berry align with menthol and clove. Savory and elegant, the smooth palate delivers chocolate-covered cherry, raspberry compote and tobacco alongside taut polished tannins. It closes on a mineral note of rusty nail. Drink through 2026. Editor's choice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bianchi 2011 Vigneto Valferana Riserva  (Gattinara)

Description: Eucalyptus, black-skinned-berry and violet aromas mingle with whiffs of new leather and truffle. Juicy and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, spiced cranberry and licorice framed in taut refined tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandrone 2017 Valmaggiore  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Smooth and enveloping, this offers aromas of tobacco, baked plum and blue flower. The savory, fleshy palate is already accessible, offering mature black cherry, raspberry compote and baking spice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Musso 2015 Pora Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This fragrant red opens with aromas evoking violet, mature berry and baking spice. The taut palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and a hint of blood orange alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2017 Cascina Crosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Mature berry, botanical herb, leather and violet aromas take shape on this full-bodied red. On the concentrated palate, polished fine-grained tannins cushion dried black cherry and tobacco. It's already approachable but will also offer good mid-term aging. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of cedar, pine forest, leather and a whiff of blue flower shape the nose. The full-bodied palate offers dried cherry, ground clove and tobacco alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to enjoy and to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Punset 2015 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild-rose, forest-berry, camphor and dark-spice aromas mingle together in the glass. It's polished and medium-bodied, with flavors of raspberry compote, mint, licorice and white pepper framed in taut smooth tannins. The tannins need to unwind a bit but drink sooner rather than later to capture the fruit richness. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2015 Serraboella Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, tilled soil, camphor and new leather aromas mingle together in the glass. Firmly structured and austere, the linear palate features sour cherry, orange zest and licorice alongside tightly wound fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torraccia del Piantavigna 2015  Gattinara

Description: Aromas evoking blue flower and baked plum mingle with a whiff of menthol. Reflecting the nose, the accessible, full-bodied palate offers prune, ripe black cherry and a hint of mocha alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Demarie 2016  Barbaresco

Description: Camphor, pressed rose, new leather and forest-berry aromas form the inviting nose. On the enveloping, savory palate, fine-grained tannins accompany mature plum, dried morello cherry and baking spice. It's already accessible but will also offer several year of drinking pleasure. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Francone 2016 Fausoni  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue flower, botanical herb and a whiff of camphor form the subtle nose. On the linear, focused palate, fine-grained, drying tannins accompany dried cherry, cranberry and a hint of baking spice. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carlo Giacosa 2017 Montefico  (Barbaresco)

Description: Mature black-skinned fruit, violet and a whiff of vanilla waft out of the glass. On the already approachable palate, rounded tannins accompany baked plum and fleshy morello cherry. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Maria 2016  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of truffle, scorched earth, carob and prune form the nose. The aromas follow over to the mature palate along with blood orange and tobacco framed in velvety tannins. It's evolved and ready to drink so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pier Paolo Grasso 2009 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, truffle and botanical herb waft out of the glass along with whispers of melted chocolate and dark spice. On the elegantly structured palate, taut fine-grained tannins accompany dried black cherry, licorice and tobacco.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bianchi 2011  Ghemme

Description: Warm and inviting aromas of grilled herb, toasted nut, mocha and mature berry make their way to the forefront. Muscular and concentrated, the enveloping palate doles out dried cherry, hazelnut and licorice alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2017 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Black-skinned berry, leather and underbrush aromas emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers black cherry, cinnamon and tobacco alongside firm, polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Traversa 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Warm and inviting aromas of grilled herb, toasted nut, mocha and mature berry make their way to the forefront. Muscular and concentrated, the enveloping palate doles out dried cherry, hazelnut and licorice alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2017 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Pressed rose, botanical herb, new leather and a whiff of truffle form the nose. On the firm full-bodied palate, tight close-grained tannins accompany cranberry, blood orange and star anise while bright acidity keeps it balanced. It's quite austere and needs time to fully come around. Drink after 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bera 2013 Rabajà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: New leather, truffle and baked plum aromas mingle with fragrant purple flower. The medium-bodied palate offers prune, vanilla, dried blackberry alongside dusty, not very persistent tannins before finishing on a note of star anise. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Traversa 2015 Canova Ciabot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of rose, forest berry and a whiff of rusty iron lift out of the glass. The linear palate features dried cherry, blood orange and a hint of star anise alongside assertive grainy tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ganghija 2017  Barbaresco

Description: This solid red opens with aromas suggesting camphor, new leather, rose and a whiff of mature berry. On the full-bodied palate, dusty, rather drying tannins accompany dried cherry, espresso and a hint of hazelnut. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pertinace 2017  Barbaresco

Description: This solid red opens with aromas suggesting camphor, new leather, rose and a whiff of mature berry. On the full-bodied palate, dusty, rather drying tannins accompany dried cherry, espresso and a hint of hazelnut. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pertinace 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Botanical herb, pressed rose, leather and underbrush aromas slowly come to the forefront. On the full-bodied austere palate, assertive, rather grainy tannins accompany dried cherry, licorice and espresso before a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ada Nada 2015 Rombone Cichin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Brawny and concentrated, this opens with aromas of violet, baked plum and oak-driven spice. On the meaty palate, grainy drying tannins accompany dried black cherry, licorice and the heat of evident alcohol that throws it somewhat off balance. It shows the scorching heat of the vintage and the fruit is evolving fast so despite the tannins, drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Grasso Fratelli 2017 Vallegrande  (Barbaresco)

Description: Mature plum, blue flower and a whiff of new leather form the nose. On the solid, no-frills palate, dusty tannins accompany dried cherry and hints of tobacco. Drink 2022–2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Taliano 2017 Montersino Ad Altiora  (Barbaresco)

Description: Lightly scented, this has delicate aromas suggesting camphor, scorched earth and violet. The straightforward palate offers dried cherry, blood orange and a hint of baking spice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Varej 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, cedar, and dark-skinned fruit lead the way. The full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside dusty tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2013 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, cedar, and dark-skinned fruit lead the way. The full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside dusty tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2013 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, underbrush and a whiff of camphor waft out of the glass. The assertive palate evokes dried cherry, coconut and a hint of roasted coffee bean framed in grainy tannins that leave a lean astringent finish. Despite the mouth-drying tannins, drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2010 Spezie Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas of French oak, leather, underbrush and tobacco waft out of the glass. Firmly structured, the palate offers suggestions of steeped prune and licorice alongside close-grained tannins that grip the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Francone 2017 I Patriarchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Dark-skinned fruit, tobacco-leaf and underbrush aromas come together on this. The straightforward no-frills palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and baking spice alongside polished tannins. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gabriele Scaglione 2015 Come un Volo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas suggesting scorched earth, new leather, tobacco and prune form the nose. The firm palate reflects the nose offering dried cherry, mocha and a hint of licorice alongside close-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carlo Giacosa 2015 Luca Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subtle aromas of cedar, scorched earth and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The tight palate offers sour cherry, roasted coffee bean and toasted hazelnut alongside grainy tannins that leave a rather drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Rivella 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of rose, truffle, chopped mint and prune lead the nose. On the lean palate, notes of French oak, vanilla and coconut accent a core of dried cherry. Close-grained, drying tannins grip the firm finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Rabaglio 2017 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, scorched earth and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers cranberry, clove and white pepper alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricossa 2017  Barbaresco

Description: This medium-bodied wine offers aromas of red berry, violet and a whiff of baking spice. On the no-frills approachable palate, dusty tannins accompany juicy Marasca cherry and ground clove. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2017 Magno  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose doesn't give much away while the brawny, monolithic palate evokes steeped prune, espresso and powdered sage alongside astringent tannins that dry out the finish. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. It lacks energy and verve.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy 2016 Gaiun Martinenga  (Barbaresco)
Winery: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy

Description: Aromas of coconut, graphite and French oak form the nose. The palate offers prune, vanilla and espresso alongside close-grained, drying tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pelissero 2017 Nubiola  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, espresso and baked plum lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the tight, rather austere palate offers prune and coconut set against firm grainy tannins that leave an astringent, mouth-drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pelissero 2017 Tulin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, chopped celery and cooking spice form the nose. The no-frills palate offers prune, clove and vanilla alongside dusty, rather astringent tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pilone nei Rivetti 2015 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of espresso, toasted oak and baking spice are front and center. The densely concentrated, solid palate offers baked plum, mocha and coconut alongside grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pelissero 2017 Vanotu  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of stewed prune, chopped celery, French oak and eucalyptus form the nose. The palate is already rather evolved, showing dried cherry and tobacco framed in dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Piazzo 2015 Vigna Gaia Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, hazelnut and French oak aromas lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate along with coconut, powdered sage, roasted coffee bean and hints of unripe cherry and blood orange. Close-grained tannins generate a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruno Rocca 2014 Rabajà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, tilled soil and dark-skinned berry. The solid, no-frills palate offers tart cherry, clove and star anise alongside grainy tannins. Drink after 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Salvano 2016  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with aromas of mocha, leafy underbrush, and camphor. The brawny palate offers toasted oak, steeped prune and licorice alongside close-grained drying tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca'Romè 2017 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has an initially shy nose that eventually offers aromas of baked plum, espresso and coconut. On the austere palate, astringent tannins accompany dried cherry and botanical herb before a mouth-drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Francone 2017 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually offers whiffs of scorched earth, used leather, coconut and a touch of violet. Showing the scorching heat of the vintage, the palate is assertive but lean on fruit richness, showing dried cherry, prune, tobacco and truffle alongside drying astringent tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Grimaldi Luigino 2017 Manzola  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor and pressed rose form the subtle nose. On the buffed palate, close-grained drying tannins accompany dried cherry, coconut and a hint of roasted coffee bean before a rather short astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Rivella 2017 Montestefano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, new leather and ripe black-skinned-berry aromas form the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, dusty drying tannins accompany dried cherry and star anise before a rather abrupt, drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Piazzo 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Toasted oak, resin and violet aromas appear in the glass. The assertive palate shows cherry marinated in spirits, orange zest and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sassi San Cristoforo 2015 San Cristoforo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant blue-flower and wild red-berry aromas lead the nose on this young fragrant red. Fresh and linear, the palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and rusty iron notes alongside vibrant acidity and taut, polished tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bianchi 2018 Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Toasted oak, resin and violet aromas appear in the glass. The assertive palate shows cherry marinated in spirits, orange zest and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sassi San Cristoforo 2015 San Cristoforo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of grilled Porcini mushroom, leather and toasted nut form the subtle nose along with a whiff of eucalyptus. The austere palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, offering suggestions of unripe cherry and medicinal herb alongside grainy, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2013 Cascina Bordino Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of camphor, scorched earth, coconut and dark spice form the nose. The assertive palate is shy on fruit richness, offering instead roasted coffee bean, licorice and powdered sage alongside the barest hint of blood orange. Assertive, grainy tannins leave an astringent close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy 2015 Martinenga Camp Gros Riserva  (Barbaresco)
Winery: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy and tart plum-skin aromas meet with an oaky cinnamon-like spice on the nose of this bottling. Dusty tannins frame the roasted strawberry, mace and pine-needle flavors on the sip, which are very powerful.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas VIneyard Nebbiolo (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subdued aromas of baking spice, leafy underbrush and camphor. The unyielding palate offers suggestions of sour cherry, clove and black pepper alongside solid tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Taliano 2012 Montersino Tera Mia Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers aromas of violet, game and botanical herb. The assertive palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, featuring truffle, prune, coffee bean and a hint of powdered sage alongside astringent, grainy tannins that dry out the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ganghija 2017 Giacosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers aromas of violet, game and botanical herb. The assertive palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, featuring truffle, prune, coffee bean and a hint of powdered sage alongside astringent, grainy tannins that dry out the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ganghija 2017 Giacosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas evoking minestrone soup, camphor and a hint of stewed prune slowly appear in the glass. The palate isn't very expressive and is shy on fruit richness, evoking notes of licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside the merest suggestion of blood orange. Grainy tannins clench the astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Spinetta 2017 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, new leather and a whiff of pressed blue flower form the subtle nose. Showing the heat of the vintage, the solid, no-frills palate offers suggestions of prune and ground clove alongside grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2017 La Casa in Collina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting used leather, cedar and scorched soil slowly emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers sour cherry, vanilla and espresso alongside grainy tannins that lead to an astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca'Romè 2017 Chiaramanti  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas of tilled soil, dark-skinned fruit and underbrush slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers sour cherry, sage and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casali del Barone 2017  Barbaresco

Description: This young red has aromas of dark-skinned berry, coconut and dark spice. On the austere palate, firm drying tannins accompany notes of sour cherry and a hint of white pepper before a lean mouth-drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torraccia del Piantavigna 2018 Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Aromas suggesting scorched earth and French oak form the shy nose along with a whiff of dried botanical herb. Reflecting the aromas and the heat of the scorching vintage, the subdued, one-dimensional palate offers toasted hazelnut, espresso and the merest hint of dried cherry. It's evolving fast, so drink soon to capture what fruit remains.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2017 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas reminiscent of camphor, dried herb, new leather and a whiff of cellar floor form the nose. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate is rather lean and evolved in terms of fruit richness, delivering dried cherry, blood orange and a hint of coffee bean alongside dusty drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bera 2011 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Toasted oak, spice and hazelnut aromas lead the nose. The dry palate offers flavors roasted coffee bean, cherry marinated in spirits and powdered sage set against raspy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dezzani 2014 Stardé  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose slowly reveals aromas of scorched underbrush, leather and camphor. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate suggests steeped prune and star anise but it lacks fruit richness. Assertive tannins leave a lean drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Francone 2015 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking porcini mushroom, camphor, iris and baked plum. The palate is already evolved, offering the barest hints of prune and clove alongside buffed, rather fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Punset 2013 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has herbaceous aromas evoking crushed mint and wild herb that mingle with a whiffs of forest floor. Taut and linear, the palate offers dried cherry, star anise and a hint of rusty nail alongside dusty drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Chiosso 2011 Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Aromas of celery, grilled vegetables and eucalyptus oil form the unusual nose. The full-bodied assertive palate offers the merest suggestions of prunes soaked in spirits, menthol, powdered sage and a hint of roasted coffee bean. Close-grained tannins generate a bracing, mouth-drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Spinetta 2017 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking porcini mushroom, camphor, iris and baked plum. The palate is already evolved, offering the barest hints of prune and clove alongside buffed, rather fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Punset 2013 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, blue-flower and baked plum aromas lead the nose. On the simple palate, dusty drying tannins accompany prune, vanilla and a hint of tobacco before a lean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Currà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of violet, resin and plum cake lead the way. The lean palate isn't as expressive as the nose, suggesting prune and a dollop of vanilla alongside grainy drying tannins that lead to an abrupt astringent close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rattalino 2014 Quarantacinque45  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of cedar, toasted hazelnut and scorched earth slowly emerge from the glass. The dense, monolithic palate offers steeped prune and mocha alongside close-grained tannins and the scorching heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2017 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals suggestions of chopped celery, cellar floor and camphor. The austere palate lacks fruit richness, offering powdered sage, ground clove and the merest hint of dried cherry. Grainy but fleeting tannins leave a lean mouth-drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Spinetta 2017 Vigneto Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: The nose is initially rather closed but eventually reveals whiffs of resin, French oak and weedy underbrush. The palate is quite short and simple for Barbaresco, offering suggestions of prune and dark spice alongside dusty fleeting tannins that leave an abrupt drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dezzani 2016  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of stewed prune and a hint of carob form the nose. The aromas carry over to the extremely evolved palate along with dusty fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivata 2016  Barbaresco

Description: This easygoing red has aromas of blue flower and red berry while the extremely simple palate suggests unripe cranberry and a hint of clove. Loose tannins give it a relaxed structure. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca Felice 2017 Famiglia Lanzavecchia  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has subtle aromas evoking pipe plum, used leather and scorched underbrush. The hard no-frills palate suggests prune and powdered sage set against raspy tannins that leave an abrupt, extremely astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Taverna 2017  Barbaresco

Description: Perfumed berry, fragrant purple flowers, chopped mint and baking spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this drop-dead gorgeous wine. Impeccably balanced, structured, and loaded with finesse, it boasts a smooth texture, doling out juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and white pepper alongside a backbone of polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2024–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Scavino 2016 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: The newest addition to the firm's iconic offerings, this is the result of 25 years of Sandrone's experiments with very old Nebbiolo vines. It's an impressive combination of power and finesse, opening with aromas of smoke, woodland berry, camphor, wild herb, new leather and truffle. The chiseled palate boasts youthful tension, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, tobacco and tangy mineral set against a backbone of youthfully austere but refined tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it impeccably balanced. Hold on to this one and you'll be rewarded. Drink 2026–2056.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandrone 2014 Vite Talin  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, camphor, forest berry and a potpourri of botanical herbs lead the way on this stunning wine. The chiseled, savory palate is loaded with finesse and intriguing tension, doling out pomegranate, blood orange, licorice and truffle while flinty mineral adds depth. Firm, refined tannins and bright acidity provide the elegant backbone. Drink through 2034.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Arpepe 2009 Sassella Rocce Rosse  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Rose, iris, woodland berry and crushed mint aromas shape the irresistible nose on this radiant, classy red. Showing a remarkable combination of structure, elegance and pedigree, the delicious, focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and an almost salty minerality while firm but ultrarefined tannins provide seamless support. Bright acidity bestows impeccable balance and youthful tension. Drink 2024–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina del Pino 2016 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

Description: What a gorgeous showing.
